settings.title: Who Is Icebreaker?
settings.content: Icebreaker was created by a 24-year-old Jeremy Moon back in 1995. His aim was to provide garments for outdoor adventures with less reliance on petrochemical fibers, providing a more sustainable future for us.

settings.title: Why We Love Icebreaker
settings.content: Icebreaker's versatile range of clothes are durable, lightweight and soft. Made with the finest merino wool to be warm in the winter and cool in the summer.

settings.title: Our History Together
settings.content: For many years we have carried Icebreaker and backed their belief that nature has the solutions, with natural performance alternatives to synthetic based apparel to create a healthier more sustainable future for our species and the planet.

settings.html: Not only was icebreaker the first company to see the potential of merino wool, but they were also the first in the world to establish long-term contracts with their key merino wool growers, based on genuine trust and a mutual concern for animal welfare and protection of the natural environment. So, what makes merino an incredible natural performance fiber and beautiful fabric to wear?

settings.title: Moisture Management
settings.content: The merino fiber can actively manage moisture by absorbing from the skin and then desorbing to the atmosphere, leaving you dryer and more comfortable. A merino fiber will absorb up to 35% of its own weight in water before feeling wet, much greater than most synthetic fibers.

settings.title: Resilience
settings.content: Wool fiber has very good extensibility and can be extended by more than 30% of its length without breaking and, in turn, can recover from extensions of approximately 20%. Merino wool also has an intrinsic wavelike structure called crimp making it more resilient.

settings.title: Softness
settings.content: Fine fibers from sheep such as merino, are comfortable and soft enough to be worn next to the skin. icebreaker Merino fibers are so fine that when in contact with the skin they simply bend, providing softness and comfort.

settings.title: Moisture Management

settings.title: Softness
settings.content: Fine fibers from sheep such as merino, are comfortable and soft enough to be worn next to the skin. icebreaker Merino fibers are so fine that when in contact with the skin they simply bend, providing softness and comfort.

settings.title: Flammability
settings.content: Merino is naturally flame resistant, and its performance exceeds that of all other commonly encountered textile fibers. If merino comes into direct contact with another burning surface, it won’t melt or stick.

settings.title: Thermoregulation
settings.content: Merino is a technically active fiber, which has the ability to gain and release heat depending on the wearer's next-to-skin environment and the external conditions. As merino absorbs moisture it releases a small amount of heat, and in hot conditions the reverse effect occurs. This means you stay warmer in cold conditions and cooler in hot conditions. It's like wearing your own personal air conditioning system.

settings.title: Odor Control
settings.content: Merino outperforms other fibers with its ability to resist the build-up of unpleasant odors. Odor molecules are absorbed into the merino fiber, effectively becoming trapped and less readily detected by the human nose.
